post.title: Your Irregular Reminder That You're In a Bubble

blockquote.p: No matter how correct that statement might be, it is undeniably partisan and inflammatory.

div.p: 42% of Americans believe in creationism. If we apply your standard, any discussion of biological evolution also is "partisan and inflammatory" despite its undeniable and easily accessible evidence.
Would you uphold the same standards for discussions of evolution or paleontology? Must I preface with a careful citation of The Origin of Species any time we discuss dinosaurs or hunter-gathers?

The only justification for one, but not the other, is to privilege the inflammation of leftists vis-a-vis rightists. I guarantee you that a far higher proportion of Americans are offended by evolution than crime statistics. It maybe only doesn't seem this way because most of us in this community (myself included) live in a blue tribe bubble. There's no Christian fundamentalist equivalent of Sneer Club who's whipping up Twitter mobs against us.
